Class Implementor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.ifmo.rain.daminov.implementor.Implementor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Impler, JarImpler

    public class Implementor
extends Object
implements Impler, JarImpler
    Implementing classes for interfaces Impler and JarImpler

    • Method Detail

      • nullCheck

        private void nullCheck(Object... args)
                throws ImplerException
        Checks if any of given arguments is null
        Parameters:
        args - list of arguments
        Throws:
        ImplerException - if any arguments is null

      • implement

        public void implement(Class<?> aClass,
                      Path path)
               throws ImplerException
        This method gets the existing Class/Interface and implements/expands it. The generated class will have suffix Impl.
        Specified by:
        implement in interface Impler
        Parameters:
        aClass - Class or Interface to implement.
        path - The location of generated class.
        Throws:
        ImplerException - ImplerException if the given class cannot be generated.
        • If the given aClass is not class of interface.
        • The aClass is final.
        • The process is not allowed to create files or directories.
        • Interface contains only private constructors.
        • The problems with I/O.

      • printPackage

        private void printPackage()
                   throws IOException
        If the class mainClass isn't located in default package, prints concatenation of string "package " and given class package name.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurred while writing to the destination file via BufferedWriter.

      • printModifiers

        private String printModifiers(int modifier)
        Generate string containing modifiers divided with space from the given int except Modifier.ABSTRACT, Modifier.TRANSIENT, Modifier.INTERFACE. Uses Modifier to convert to String. The mask values representing the modifiers is described there.
        Parameters:
        modifier - the byte mask of the modifiers.
        Returns:
        The string generated from given int.

      • printTitle

        private void printTitle()
                 throws IOException
        Prints header of generated mainClass.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurred while writing to the destination file via BufferedWriter.

      • printArgs

        private String printArgs(Class<?>[] argList)
        Generates the string, denoting the argument-list of method or constructor. Arguments are named varName + i, where i is ordinal number of argument.
        Parameters:
        argList - The array of types of arguments.
        Returns:
        The string, denoting arguments list.

      • printExceptions

        private String printExceptions(Class<?>[] excList)
        Generates the string of next pattern: throws a, b, c, ... where a, b, c are some types. This method generates exception for constructors by its exceptions array.
        Parameters:
        excList - The array of type of exceptions, thrown by constructor.
        Returns:
        Generated String.

      • printConstructors

        private void printConstructors()
                        throws IOException,
                               ImplerException
        Implements all constructors of the class/interface mainClass.
        Throws:
        ImplerException - If mainClass is class with no public constructors.
        IOException - if an error occurred while writing to the destination file via BufferedWriter.

      • printMethods

        private void printMethods()
                   throws IOException
        Implements all methods from class or interface mainClass and public and protected methods of its superclasses.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurred while writing to the destination file via. BufferedWriter

      • addMethods

        private void addMethods(Set<Implementor.MethodWrapper> set,
                        Method[] methods)
        Filters given array of Method, leaving only declared as abstract and puts them in given Set, after wrapping them to Implementor.MethodWrapper
        Parameters:
        methods - given array of Method
        set - Set where to store methods

      • createDirectory

        private Path createDirectory(Path root,
                             Class<?> aClass,
                             String suffix)
                      throws IOException
        By given Class object creates directory for its java source or object file. It means that directories for packages are also created. If directories exist, nothing happens. Then returns the relative path to file.
        Parameters:
        root - The location, where packages directories are created.
        aClass - The class object containing its packages data.
        suffix - File expansion. java-source or java-object file.
        Returns:
        The relative path to given class file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Directories are created using Files.createDirectories(Path, FileAttribute[]) and all its exceptions are thrown by this method.

      • implementJar

        public void implementJar(Class<?> aClass,
                         Path path)
                  throws ImplerException
        Implements the given class and creates Jar-Archive with resulting class.
        Specified by:
        implementJar in interface JarImpler
        Parameters:
        aClass - the given class.
        path - destination of Jar-Archive.
        Throws:
        ImplerException -
        • I/O Exceptions while creating, reading or deleting files and directories.
        • Exceptions thrown by implement(Class, Path).
        See Also:
        implement(Class, Path)

      • createJarFile

        private void createJarFile(Path dirs,
                           Path pathFile,
                           Path path)
                    throws IOException
        Creates Jar file in the given directory and stores the given file in it.
        Parameters:
        dirs - The location of package of java-class that need to be stored in archive.
        pathFile - The absolute path to java-class.
        path - The directory, where jar file is stored.
        Throws:
        IOException - If error occurred while using JarOutputStream or opening fileStream to path.

      • clean

        private void clean(Path root)
            throws IOException
        Remove the given file/directory and everything in it.
        Parameters:
        root - the path to the given file/directory.
        Throws:
        IOException - If error occurs while deleting files.
        SecurityException - If the security manager denies access to the starting file. In the case of the. default provider, the checkRead method is invoked to check read access to the directory.

      • createAndCompile

        private Path createAndCompile(Class<?> aClass,
                              Path temporaryDir)
                       throws ImplerException,
                              IOException
        Implements the given class in given directory, compiles it and stores its object file there.
        Parameters:
        aClass - the given class.
        temporaryDir - directory to store output files.
        Returns:
        Path to created object file.
        Throws:
        ImplerException - If error occurred while compiling or creating files.
        IOException - If error occurred while compiling or creating files.
        NullPointerException - if compiler can't be accessed.
        See Also:
        implement(Class, Path)

      • returnImpl

        private String returnImpl(Class<?> aClass)
        Generates the string "return x;", where x is 0, false, null or empty string. Chooses the variant to fit returning type of method.
        Parameters:
        aClass - The returning type of method.
        Returns:
        Generated string.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Runs Class-Implementor (method implement) or Creates Jar(method jarImplement).
        Parameters:
        args - The array of arguments for Implementor. There are 2 variants of arguments for running main:
        • -jar fullClassName generatedFilesLocation. The jarImplement method called.
        • fullClassName generatedFilesLocation. The implement method is called.
